contents:
Click the link below to open the article in a new window.

Link to article

After you're finished reading, please close the news article's window and return to this window.

According to this article inner talking is not common among people. It only shows up in maybe a quarter of any large group of people. The same goes for inner seeing and feeling. There are people who constantly have an inner dialogue going on in their mind, others that never have it and still others that only occasionally do it. The article mentions some psychologists and linguists who think it is impossible to not have a way of talking to ourselves all the time such as when we see a word it follows that we have an image of that word in our mind. The author of the article disputes these claims and talks about how science doesn't really have a good method of identifying people who use inner speaking or the other experiences.

The article was summarized as it is not very common that people have an inner dialogue going on in their head. And when people are in a group, it is not as common that people are thinking among themselves.

Most people do not reflect to their inner self or have a running dialogue in their own self. They do not reflect on their own thoughts and emotions. When people are in a group setting they don't really think for their self. They use the suggestions of the group or go with the majority of the group. Overall, people are not using their minds to think effectively and are just going with the crowd.
